thread.title: Chinese President Jinping says no to naming Mark Zuckerbergs unborn child
thread.title_full: Chinese President Jinping says no to naming Mark Zuckerbergs unborn child

title: Chinese President Jinping says no to naming Mark Zuckerbergs unborn child
text:
Chinese President Jinping 'says no' to naming Mark Zuckerberg's unborn child 
Technology Industry News.Net (ANI) : Sunday 4th October, 2015 
Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg was left disappointed when Chinese President Xi Jinping refused his request to name his unborn child at a White House dinner last week. 
With Facebook still banned in China, the President remained unyielding to Zuckerberg as he turned down his request for a Chinese name for his child, the shanghaiist.com said. 
Zuckerberg was seated at the head table with United States President Barack Obama and his family and Jinping and his wife Peng Liyuan at the state dinner, which was attended by several figures from the US tech and media sectors. 
According to reports, Zuckerberg spoke in Mandarin to the president, asking him whether or not he would do him and his wife the honor of giving his child an honorary Chinese name. 
Xi reportedly turned down the request to put forward a name for the Facebook founder's unborn baby girl, saying that it would be "too much responsibility." 
Other guests at the state dinner included Apple CEO Tim Cook, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, former Oracle CEO Larry Ellison and and Dreamworks Animation CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg. (ANI) More Technology Industry News   'immoral' tactics
